evs.utilities.matrix
Class DoubleMatrix2D

java.lang.Object
  evs.utilities.matrix.Matrix
      evs.utilities.matrix.Matrix2D
          evs.utilities.matrix.DoubleMatrix2D
All Implemented Interfaces:
DoubleMatrix, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DenseDoubleMatrix2D
public abstract class DoubleMatrix2D
extends Matrix2D
implements DoubleMatrix

Abstract base class for a 2D double matrix.

Version:
4.0
Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com
See Also:
Serialized Form

assign

public abstract DoubleMatrix2D assign(DoubleMatrix2D input,
                                      DoubleDoubleFunction function,
                                      boolean overwrite,
                                      double avoid,
                                      int startRow,
                                      int startCol,
                                      int endRow,
                                      int endCol)
                               throws java.lang.ArithmeticException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Applies a double function to the current matrix and a numeric input matrix, ignoring the specified value in the current matrix. Specify a sub-matrix on which to apply the function. The rows and columns defined by the boundaries are included in the calculation. The result may be assigned to the current matrix, in which case the cells outside the sub-matrix will remain unchanged. Otherwise, they will contain the default double value.

Parameters:
input - a matrix with identical dimensions
function - a function
overwrite - is true to assign the result to the current matrix, false for a deep copy
avoid - a number to avoid
startRow - the start row
startCol - the start column
endRow - the end row
endCol - the end column
Returns:
this f.apply(this, input)
Throws:
java.lang.ArithmeticException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

assign

public abstract DoubleMatrix2D assign(DoubleFunction function,
                                      boolean overwrite,
                                      double avoid,
                                      int startRow,
                                      int startCol,
                                      int endRow,
                                      int endCol)
                               throws java.lang.ArithmeticException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Applies a double function to the current matrix ignoring the specified value in the current matrix. Specify a sub-matrix on which to apply the function. The rows and columns defined by the boundaries are included in the calculation. The result may be assigned to the current matrix, in which case the cells outside the sub-matrix will remain unchanged. Otherwise, they will contain the default double value.

Parameters:
function - a function
overwrite - is true to assign the result to the current matrix, false for a deep copy
avoid - a number to avoid
startRow - the start row
startCol - the start column
endRow - the end row
endCol - the end column
Returns:
this f.apply(this, input)
Throws:
java.lang.ArithmeticException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

assignByRow

public abstract DoubleMatrix1D assignByRow(VectorFunction function)
                                    throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
Assigns a vector function row-wise. Transpose first to assign column-wise.

Parameters:
function - a vector function
Returns:
a 1D matrix with as many elements as rows in the input, each containing the result of applying the vector function to that row
Throws:
java.lang.ArithmeticException

                                           double avoid,
                                           int start,
                                           int end)
                                    throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
Assigns a vector function row-wise. Transpose first to assign column-wise.

Parameters:

avoid - a number to avoid
start - a start column index
end - the end column index
Returns:

subRowsbyColCond

public abstract DoubleMatrix2D subRowsbyColCond(DoubleProcedure condition,
                                                int col,
                                                java.lang.Double avoid)
                                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns a subset of rows in which the specified column meets the specified condition or throws an exception if the column index is out of range or no such rows exist. If the column contains the avoid number, the corresponding row is not returned.

Parameters:
condition - the condition
col - the column
avoid - a number to avoid (may be null)
Returns:
the rows in which the specified column value meets the condition
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

subRowsbyColCond

public abstract DoubleMatrix2D subRowsbyColCond(DoubleProcedure condition,
                                                java.lang.Double avoid,
                                                boolean invert)
                                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns a subset of rows in which any of the columns meets the specified condition or throws an exception if no such rows exist. Optionally, the function may be inverted, such that the opposite rows are returned. The condition is not evaluated for a column whose value equals the non-null avoid number.

Parameters:
condition - the condition
avoid - a number to avoid (may be null)
invert - is true to inverse the function
Returns:
the rows in which the specified column value meets the condition
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

subRowsbyRowCond

public abstract DoubleMatrix2D subRowsbyRowCond(DoubleProcedure condition,
                                                VectorFunction rowFunc,
                                                int startCol,
                                                int endCol,
                                                java.lang.Double avoid)
                                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns a subset of rows that meet the row condition after applying the specified row function.

Parameters:
condition - the row condition
rowFunc - the row function
startCol - the start column at which to apply the row function
endCol - the end column at which to apply the row function
avoid - a number to avoid (may be null)
Returns:
the rows that meet the specified condition
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

appendRowsShallow

public abstract DoubleMatrix2D appendRowsShallow(DoubleMatrix2D input)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Append the input matrix to the bottom of the current matrix. The input matrix must have the same number of columns as the current matrix. Rows are shallow copied. returns the result in a new matrix.

Parameters:
input - the input matrix
Returns:
a shallow appended matrix
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

insert

public abstract DoubleMatrix2D insert(DoubleMatrix1D insertMe,
                                      int index,
                                      boolean isRow)
                               throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Inserts a specified row or column into the matrix and returns the deep copied matrix.

Parameters:
insertMe - the row or column to insert
index - the zero based index at which to insert
isRow - is true if the insertion is a row, false for column
Returns:
the deep copied matrix with the inserted vector
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

remove

public abstract DoubleMatrix2D remove(int removeMe,
                                      boolean isRow)
                               throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Removes a specified row or column from the matrix and returns the deep copied matrix.

Parameters:
removeMe - the row or column index to remove
isRow - is true to remove a row, false to remove a column
Returns:
the deep copied matrix with the removed vector
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of a double matrix with as many decimal places as required for its elements. This method is not specifically intended for raw screen output as tabs are used.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a string representation of the matrix.

toString

public java.lang.String toString(int decimalPlaces)
Returns a string representation of a double matrix with a specified number of decimal places for its elements. This method is not specifically intended for raw screen output; appearance will vary with the number of decimal places as tabs are used.

Parameters:
decimalPlaces - the number of decimal places required for the matrix elements.
Returns:
a string representation of the matrix.
